pullRequest.body:
Shows that the forgetful functor `forget T : Coalgebra T â¥¤ C` for a comonad `T : C â¥¤ C` creates colimits and creates any limits which `T` preserves. This is used to show that `Coalgebra T` has any colimits which `C` has, and any limits which `C` has and `T` preserves. This is generalised to the case of a comonadic functor `D â¥¤ C`.

Dualises everything currently in [Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Monad.Limits](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Monad/Limits.html).

This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing Algebraic Geometry" in June 2024.

---

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9878742596/job/27283346267)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9878742596/job/27283346718)
Is this also prop 5.3.3 in [Riehl]? In any case, can you add a reference to [Riehl] like above?
This is just the dual statement, so I think it's appropriate to also refer to 5.3.3. I will add a comment.
Isn't it called something other than "apex" for cocones? Alternatively, you can use the mathlib terminology "cocone point".
I think "nadir" is an option, but since we use "apex" and not "zenith" for cones, I prefer "(co)cone point." I'll change both.

```suggestion
/-- The coreflector always preserves initial objects. Note this in general doesn't apply to any
other colimit.
-/
noncomputable def rightAdjointPreservesInitialOfCoreflective (R : D â¥¤ C) [Coreflective R] :
```
